name: lameness
content:
lameness noun [U]
(inability to walk)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being unable to walk correctly because of physical injury to or weakness in the legs or feet: Injuries such as bone fractures can lead to lameness in horses. His lameness prevented him from taking much exercise.
More examplesFewer examplesDogs will be given an initial exam for lameness.A fall as a child had led to hip disease and permanent lameness.Animals suffered from lack of appetite and lameness because of foot blisters.
lameness noun [U]
(unsatisfactory)
the quality of being weak and unsatisfactory: The lameness of the excuse was surprising. His jokes are memorable for their sheer lameness.
More examplesFewer examplesWe cringed at the lameness of the question.She didn't seem to notice the lameness of the material she was being asked to perform.He shook his head and lamented the reporter's lameness.
